source.4a37b541:
from plotly.offline import iplot
import plotly.graph_objs as go

# Chile daily cases
daily_confirmed_object = go.Scatter(x=Chile_data.index, y=Chile_data['daily_confirmed'].values, name='Daily_confirmed')
daily_deaths_object = go.Scatter(x=Chile_data.index, y=Chile_data['daily_deaths'].values, name='Daily_deaths')

layout_object = go.Layout(title='Chile daily cases 19M51680', xaxis=dict(title='Dete'),yaxis=dict(title='Number of people'))
fig = go.Figure(data=[daily_confirmed_object,daily_deaths_object],layout=layout_object)
iplot(fig)
fig.write_html('Chile daily cases 19M51680.html')
source.2853b55d:
# Compare Chile and Brazil
Chile_pop_rate_deaths_object = go.Scatter(x=Chile_data.index, y=Chile_data['pop_rate_deaths'].values, name='Chile')
Brazil_pop_rate_deaths_object = go.Scatter(x=Brazil_data.index, y=Brazil_data['pop_rate_deaths'].values, name='Brazil')

layout_object2 = go.Layout(title='Chile and Brazil (death_rate per 100,000 people) 19M51680', xaxis=dict(title='Dete'),yaxis=dict(title='Number of people'))
fig2 = go.Figure(data=[Brazil_pop_rate_deaths_object,Chile_pop_rate_deaths_object],layout=layout_object2)
iplot(fig2)
fig.write_html('Chile and Brazil(death_rate per100,000)19M51680.html')
source.4e2537a6:
# Make a table of chile's situation 
Chile_data2=Chile_data[['daily_confirmed','daily_deaths','daily_recovery','Recovered']]
Chile_data2=Chile_data2.fillna(0.)
styled_object = Chile_data2.style.background_gradient(cmap='gist_ncar').highlight_max('daily_confirmed').set_caption('Daily Summaries')
display(styled_object)
f=open('Chile_data_table_19M51680.html','w')
f.write(styled_object.render())
source.4b2936a9:
# Make Global ranking table
df = pd.read_csv('../input/novel-corona-virus-2019-dataset/covid_19_data.csv',header=0)
df1= df[df['ObservationDate']=='06/12/2020']
df1_rank=df1.groupby(['Country/Region']).sum().sort_values(by=['Confirmed'],ascending=False).reset_index()
df1_rank=df1_rank[['Country/Region','Confirmed','Deaths','Recovered']]
df1_rank_object=df1_rank#.style
display(df1_rank_object)
#df1_rank_object.to_csv('ranking.csv')
df1_rank_object.to_html('Global_ranking_19M51680.html')
source.aacf7a8f:
# Calculate death and confirmed rate per 100,000 people
df2 = pd.read_csv('../input/homework2/ranking.csv',header=0)
df2['pop_rate_confirmed']=df2['Confirmed']/df2['population']*100000
df2['pop_rate_deaths']=df2['Deaths']/df2['population']*100000
df2=df2.sort_values(by=['pop_rate_deaths'],ascending=False).reset_index()
df2.to_html('pop_rate_Global_ranking_19M51680.html')
df2
source.33b56354:
# **Summarise**
The global ranking of Chile: Confirmed:13 / Deaths:20 / Recovered:10 / pop_rate_confirmed:6 / pop_rate_deaths:18

Situation : The nuber of confirmed people is dramatically increase

The largest daily cases : 6,754 (06/12/20)

# **The goverment measures**
Chile had opted selective quarantine strategy which is concentrated in the high infection areas for preventing COVID-19 pandemic. 
They are testing daily 14,000 cases and already done 200,000, it is highest rate along the countries in Latin America.

The government tried to control the infection by lockdown of metropolitan area, it worked effectively and the confirmed number was not rapidly increased until April.
One month later, the government recognized the negative impacts on their economy and education and once lifted lockdown in May. After that, the number of confirmed cases dramatically increased and the government implement lockdown on metropolitan area again from May 15th. But they couldn’t stop the overshooting.

Chile has another reason for their difficulty to prevent the infection caused by environmental problem. They faced serious drought this year and the rainfall is one quarter of the average season. The people cannot be supplied enough water to wash their hands.

Chile's death rate is 1.7%, this value is one-third of Brazil. They are still trying to control the infection by confirming cases by high test rate for preventing medical collapse. Once medical collapse has occurred, the death rate is booming rapidly.


I think lockdown is effective measure for controlling infection of COVID, but it should be done in the early stage. Chile succeeded to control the situation by lockdown in early stage, but the government couldn’t continue the measure until completely ceasing the infection. As the result of lifted lockdown, the government is now facing difficulties to control the situation. Once overshoot has happened, any measure such as lockdown is not prevent thr outbreak. Recent increasing rate of infection in Chile is similar to Brazil which is most critical country in South America. Brazil government prioritized their economy and did not take any preventing measures.
